item.title: Save $100 On Anker's Popular 140W Portable Battery Pack With Fast Charging
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/save-100-on-ankers-popular-140w-portable-battery-pack-with-fast-charging/1100-6530745/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon has a fantastic deal on Anker's popular 737 Power Bank that's definitely worth checking out before it disappears. Normally $150, you can get Anker's 140W portable laptop charger for only $50. The $100 discount is unlikely to stick around for long. Your order will ship from Amazon, but the seller of this deal is Amazon-owned retailer Woot.

Anker 737 Laptop Power Bank - 140W, 24,000mAh

$50 (was $150)

This power bank should be of particular interest to those with a gaming laptop or a power-hungry portable PC. Most battery packs in the $50 price range can't keep up with the power drain when gaming on a laptop. With the Anker 737, you'll be able to extend your playtime while away from an outlet.

Even if you don't have a gaming laptop, this high-end battery pack is a great choice for Steam Deck, MacBooks, Nintendo Switch, smartphones, and tablets. Its 24,000mAh capacity can fully charge an iPhone 16 Pro four times.

Anker is one of the most trusted names in the portable charging space, and the 737 is one of the manufacturer's most popular models thanks to its premium feature set. The battery pack has a digital display to show key figures such as input/output, the battery life of the power bank itself, and a charging time estimate for the device that's plugged into the included 140W USB-C to USB-C cable. The cable supports 3.1 fast charging for compatible devices such as smartphones and select laptops.

item.title: Minecraft Music Will Be Inducted Into The National Recording Registry
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/minecraft-music-will-be-inducted-into-the-national-recording-registry/1100-6530742/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Minecraft's soundtrack will join Microsoft’s reboot chime have been selected as some of the "defining sounds of history and culture," and will join the National Recording Registry of the Library of Congress. The sounds of Minecraft: Volume Alpha by Daniel Rosenfeld will join the music of Super Mario Bros. as one of the most important pieces of video game music ever recorded.

Also joining this year are rock and pop classics like Elton John's monumental album Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Chicago’s debut Chicago Transit Authority, the original Broadway cast recording of Hamilton, Mary J. Blige's My Life, and Amy Winehouse's Back to Black.

"These are the sounds of America--our wide-ranging history and culture. The National Recording Registry is our evolving nation's playlist," Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden said. "The Library of Congress is proud and honored to select these audio treasures worthy of preservation, including iconic music across a variety of genres, field recordings, sports history, and even the sounds of our daily lives with technology."

The addition of Minecraft makes it only the second piece of video game music inducted into the Library, after the Super Mario Bros. theme was inducted in 2023. Coincidentally, it was also inducted as The Super Mario Bros. Movie had been released in theaters.

A Minecraft Movie had a huge opening weekend, surpassing even heavy-hitters like Barbie and The Dark Knight. The film broke all expectations and nabbed $163 million in the US for its opening weekend. The film now has the biggest opening weekend of all time for a video game movie, outpacing even The Super Mario Bros. Movie.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The Last Of Us 3 Could Happen If The Stars Align, Neil Druckmann Says
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-last-of-us-3-could-happen-if-the-stars-align-neil-druckmann-says/1100-6530741/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Is there going to be a third The Last of Us game? Given the big success of the first two games and the HBO series, many are expecting more entries in the game series. But Naughty Dog boss Neil Druckmann says it would take something special for the studio to make a third game.

He told ComicBook that he's currently focused on the TV show--which was just renewed for a third season--along with the game he's directing, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet. He's not ruling out a third The Last of Us game, but he's not confirming it either.

"Back at Naughty Dog, we're now working on Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet, which is something we've been working on for many years. That is taking up all of our time," he said. "I am treating these projects like it's the last thing I will ever work on. So my assumption is that there will be no more. If the stars align, and everything comes into place, who knows?"

Druckmann went on to say the story in the first The Last of Us was structured to have a "definitive ending" because he didn't know if he would get to make a sequel. But the game was a big success and Druckmann came back for The Last of Us: Part II. He said Naughty Dog didn't have to make the sequel because Naughty Dog owner Sony trusts the company enough to make its own decisions.

"But we had an idea [for The Last of Us: Part II] that we felt passionate about. It was a good enough idea to spend years on it. We worked on the story and felt like, 'OK, that story has come full circle. The definitive ending for this moment in time,'" he said.

Druckmann is repeating himself here, as he previously addressed rumors of The Last of Us: Part III by saying he treats every game like his last and that the stars would have to align for it to come about.

In 2023, after Naughty Dog canceled The Last of Us Online, the studio said it had at least two single-player games in development. One has been revealed to be Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet, but the other remains a mystery. Reporter Daniel Richtman said The Last of Us: Part III is in production now. For what it's worth, Druckmann has said he has a story in mind for The Last of Us: Part III.

Intergalactic is reportedly not going to release until 2027 at the soonest, so if The Last of Us 3 or any other one Last of Us game came after it, fans shouldn't expect to play it soon. As for The Last of Us TV series, Season 2 premieres this Sunday, April 13.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
